alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 6:57PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern West Feliciana, West Baton Rouge, southeastern Pointe Coupee, northwestern Livingston, southern East Feliciana, northwestern Iberville and East Baton Rouge Parishes through 730 PM CDT... At 657 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Livonia to 8 miles west of Zachary to near Pride. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Denham Springs, Port Allen, New Roads, Jackson, St. Francisville, Oak Hills Place, Walker, Addis, Brusly, Livonia, Maringouin, Slaughter, Fordoche, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, Morganza and Westminster. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 128 and 167. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana; Western Ascension
